pacificmapsR 0.0.1

pacificmapsR

Quickly generating a map of a country is often an easy task. However in the wider Pacific region there are many complications. Having a simple package that implements best practice in storing and displaying map and spatial data for the Pacific will lower the barrier for others to make compelling analyses and visualisations of Pacific issues.

Installation

You can install the development version of pacificmapsR from GitHub with:

# install.packages("pak")
pak::pak("JayaniLakshika/pacificmapsR")

Issues mainly we addressed 

library(pacificmapsR)
  • To shift objects on the oneside of the dateline
dd <- read_ejson(here::here("data/2010_PHC_Kiribati_EnumArea_3832.geojson"))
plot_ejson_map(dd)

  • Changes the coordinate reference system which solves the axis label problem
dd <- read_ejson(here::here("data/2007_PHC_Fiji_EnumArea_32760.geojson"))
plot_ejson_map(dd)
